thread.title: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race at Charlotte; rescheduled for Sunday
thread.title_full: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race at Charlotte; rescheduled for Sunday

title: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race at Charlotte; rescheduled for Sunday
text:
USA TODAY Sports' Brant James breaks down this weekend's Bank of America 500 at Charlotte Motor Speedway. USA TODAY Sports
NASCAR fans watch cars go through inspection in the rain Saturday at Charlotte Motor Speedway. (Photo: Peter Casey, USA TODAY Sports)
47 CONNECT 38 TWEET LINKEDIN 2 COMMENT EMAIL MORE CONCORD, N.C. — Heavy rain forced postponement of Saturday night’s scheduled Bank of America 500 NASCAR Sprint Cup race at Charlotte Motor Speedway.
The race, the first in round two of the Chase for the Sprint Cup, was rescheduled for 12:30 p.m. ET Sunday and will be broadcast on NBC Sports Network.
Rain fell in the speedway area virtually all day Saturday. Showers continued to pelt the track as the original starting time for the race – 7:16 p.m. – approached. The postponement was announced at 6:50 p.m.
USA TODAY
Gluck: NASCAR's Chase brings thrills to fans, stress to drivers
Sunday’s forecast is greatly improved, with a predicted high of 70 and little chance of rain.
Matt Kenseth will start Sunday’s race from the pole. He led qualifying with a speed of 194.532 miles per hour. Kyle Busch, Joey Logano, Greg Biffle and Denny Hamlin follow in the top five.
USA TODAY
Matt Kenseth wins Sprint Cup pole at Charlotte
Twelve drivers remain in the hunt for the Sprint Cup championship. Winners of Sunday’s race and subsequent races at Kansas Speedway and Talladega Superspeedway — if they are Chase drivers — will advance to the third round of the playoffs. Remaining spots in the third round will be filled via points.
